memberdef.name: fillHaloC

briefdescription.para: Wrapping function for calculating halos for each block of a single variable on CPU.

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: This function is a wraping fuction of the halo functions on CPU. It is called from the main Halo CPU function. This is layer 2 of 3 wrap so the candy doesn't stick too much.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, bool doProlongation, BlockP< T > XBlock, T *z)
memberdef.name: fillHaloF

briefdescription.para: Wrapping function for calculating flux in the halos for a block and a single variable on CPU.

sect2.title: Depreciated
sect2.para: This function is was never sucessful and will never be used. It is fundamentally flawed because is doesn't preserve the balance of fluxes on the restiction interface It should be deleted soon

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T > XBlock, cudaStream_t stream, T *z)

memberdef.name: RecalculateZs

briefdescription.para: Recalculate water surface after recalculating the values on the halo on the CPU.

detaileddescription.para: Recalculate water surface after recalculating the values on the halo on the GPU.

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: Recalculate water surface after recalculating the values on the halo on the CPU. zb (bottom elevation) on each halo is calculated at the start of the loop or as part of the initial condition. When conserve-elevation is not required, only h is recalculated on the halo at ever 1/2 steps. zs then needs to be recalculated to obtain a mass-conservative solution (if zs is conserved then mass conservation is not garanteed)

sect2.title: Warning
sect2.para: This function calculate zs everywhere in the block... this is a bit unecessary. Instead it should recalculate only where there is a prolongation or a restiction

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: Recalculate water surface after recalculating the values on the halo on the CPU. zb (bottom elevation) on each halo is calculated at the start of the loop or as part of the initial condition. When conserve-elevation is not required, only h is recalculated on the halo at ever 1/2 steps. zs then needs to be recalculated to obtain a mass-conservative solution (if zs is conserved then mass conservation is not garanteed)

sect2.title: Warning
sect2.para: This function calculate zs everywhere in the block... this is a bit unecessary. Instead it should recalculate only where there is a prolongation or a restiction

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T > XBlock, EvolvingP< T > Xev, T *zb)
memberdef.name: RecalculateZsGPU
